document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Miloderes Casey, 1888 (Coleoptera: Curculionidae: Entiminae), with desciptions of three new species

Miloderes nelsoni
Kissinger, 1960

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Body clothed in long dense setae. Head with scales on frons flat. Pronotum without pattern, lateral margins strongly convex. Elytra blue to copper without pattern. Legs with front tibial apex flat, tibial brush elongate; hind tibial apex truncate. Median lobe curved. Endophallus with basal lobe not recurved and distended, dorsal lobe present weakly divided, distal projection present highly conical, endophallus terminal not recurved, median ventral lobe absent, middle of endophallus thick, ventral apical lobe present not pointed ventrally, position of ventral apical lobe low, subapical lobe free, transfer apparatus weakly sclerotized. Spermatheca with basal lobes relatively equal in length.

Distribution. (
Fig. 19
) Known only from the sand dunes of the Eureka Valley and neighboring Ubehebe dunes. Distribution is sympatric with
M. setosus
.

Intra- and interspecific morphological variation.
Miloderes nelsoni
exhibits little morphological variation. Individuals are uniform in color, which ranges from blue to pearl white to copper in the red extreme.
Miloderes ubehebensis
is similar to
M. nelsoni
except for the shape of the endophallus. The dorsal lobes are more pronounced in
M. ubehebensis
and the central portion of the endophallus is not as expanded.
